name: TV Shows With A Connection Quiz | Name The Show | 10 Questions

questions.text: This variety show starred a then-popular Top 40 singer and his two beautiful backup singers.
options: Barbara Mandrell and the Mandrell Sisters
questions.explanation:
Tony Orlando and Dawn.

	'Barbara Mandrell and the Mandrell Sisters' would have fit, but I said 'his' backup singers. BTW, Telma Hopkins, half of 'Dawn', shares my birthday, October 28.

questions.text: A faltering Ohio radio station hires a new programming director, who immediately changes the station's format to Rock 'n' Roll.
questions.explanation:
WKRP in Cincinnati.

	I still remember the 'falling turkeys' episode!

questions.text: This show, renamed twice when the actress playing the title character quit, portrayed a suburban family comprised of a husband and wife (later replaced by the husband's sister) and their three sons, the youngest two twins.
questions.explanation:
Valerie.

	Known initally as 'Valerie', then 'Valerie's Family', then finally 'The Hogan Family'.

questions.text: This cartoon was about a little boy, voiced by Howie Mandel, and his overactive imagination.
An independent single mother is harangued by the small minded members of their small town's Parent-Teacher Association.
questions.explanation:
Harper Valley PTA.

	From the movie of the same name, both starring Barbara Eden.

questions.text: An inventor invents a robot that looks like a little girl. He and his family pass her off at their own daughter.
A stock broker is caught doing insider trading. Stripped of his credentials, he finds a job as an elementary school teacher. His two teenaged daughters help him make the adjustment.
Cartoon about the adventures of the title character as a fat little boy. His mother is sweet and doting, but his father is loud and critical.
The host of this morning talk show was given it after several guest hostings of 'The Tonight Show with Johnny Carson'. The show included a full orchestra, news breaks, and a cast of regulars.
options: Live with Regis and Kathy Lee
questions.explanation:
The David Letterman Show.

	Although short-lived, it gave Dave the springboard to his very successful late-night show.

questions.text: What do these 9 shows have in common?
options: Broadcast in black-and-white after development of color broadcast
questions.explanation:
Co-star the same actress.

	Edie McClurg is one of the great character actresses of our time. In these shows, she played: a regular character actor ('Tony Orlando and Dawn'), Lucille Tarlek, Herb's wife ('WKRP in Cincinnati'), Mrs. Patty Poole, the Hogans' neighbor ('Valerie' et al), Aunt Ruth ('Bobby's World'), Williamae Jones ('Harper Valley PTA'), Bonnie Brindle ('Small Wonder'), Principal Marilyn Ridge ('Drexell's Class'), Mrs. Anderson, Louie's mother ('Life with Louie'), Mrs. Marv Mendenhall ('The David Letterman Show').
